intro: Qualea johannabakkerae, commonly known as the Johannabakkerae palm, is a rare species native to the Amazon Basin. It is a small palm tree, typically reaching heights of up to 5 meters, with a slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant is adapted to wetland environments, thriving in seasonal floodplains where it can tolerate waterlogged soil. Its flowers are small and clustered, and it produces yellowish fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
